lorebooks.name: Coyote Bend
lorebooks.website_description:
Coyote Bend sits out on the edge of the Eastern frontier carved out of dust, grit, and restless ambition. Wagons crowd the dirt roads, horses stomp at hitching posts, and the dry wind carries the tang of smoke, whiskey, and gunpowder. Life here is loud, dangerous, and fleetingâ€”fortunes rise and fall as quick as a poker hand.

Yet beneath its chaos, Coyote Bend is alive: music spilling from the saloon, traders shouting at the market, children darting between wagons, and outlaws lurking in the shadows. 

Itâ€™s a place where legends are madeâ€”or buried.
lorebooks.description:
Coyote Bend sits out on the edge of the Eastern frontier carved out of dust, grit, and restless ambition. Wagons crowd the dirt roads, horses stomp at hitching posts, and the dry wind carries the tang of smoke, whiskey, and gunpowder. Life here is loud, dangerous, and fleetingâ€”fortunes rise and fall as quick as a poker hand.

Yet beneath its chaos, Coyote Bend is alive: music spilling from the saloon, traders shouting at the market, children darting between wagons, and outlaws lurking in the shadows. 

Itâ€™s a place where legends are madeâ€”or buried.
lorebooks.creator: korosbadtrip

1.content:
Ownership: The Winfields have worked the land for years. Though Thomas runs it with a stern hand, Margaretâ€™s influence keeps the homestead warm and welcoming.
Landscape & Layout: Rolling pastures stretch wide with cattle grazing under the hot sun, wooden fencing lining the property. The main house is sturdy and practicalâ€”whitewashed wood with a wraparound porch, rocking chairs where Margaret often sits with a glass of sweet tea. The barn is large and weatherworn, red paint faded by decades, smelling of hay and leather. A corral sits nearby, used for breaking horses and training cattle dogs. Thereâ€™s a tool shed Aurelie tinkers in, half filled with practical gear and half with her â€œinventionsâ€ or repairs.
Atmosphere: The ranch is alive with movementâ€”lowing cattle, neighing horses, barking dogs, boots clomping across wooden floors. Though work is endless and the days are long, thereâ€™s a sense of belonging. Laughter rings out in the evenings, and singing sometimes drifts across the fields at dusk. This ranch is hard work, sweat, and dustâ€”but itâ€™s also home, a place built on loyalty and love that survived scandal and hardship.

2.name: The Valentine Ranch
2.content:
Ownership: Once shared between Beau and his late wife, Dakota. After her passing, Beau shoulders the burden alone, running it with grit and quiet determination. The land feels like it remembers her, each corner heavy with memory.
Landscape & Layout: Larger and more sprawling than most, with wide-open pastures leading into rugged hills. The main house is simple but well-keptâ€”sturdy timber, strong beams, and a porch that looks out toward the horizon. Dakota had filled it with touches of warmthâ€”curtains she sewed, wildflowers in jars, little details Beau never changed. The barn is massive, home to mustangs Beau trains, and the corrals are always full of restless energy. Thereâ€™s a creek that runs through the back edge of the land, a spot Beau and Dakota once called â€œtheir place.â€
Atmosphere: The ranch carries an air of solitude, almost sacred. Itâ€™s quieter than the Winfield placeâ€”more orderly, more disciplinedâ€”but beneath the silence lingers the echo of whatâ€™s been lost. Beau keeps it running with precision, and his hands shape every piece of it: fences mended, horses broken, cattle tended. For all its size and strength, thereâ€™s a loneliness to the ranch, as though it waits for laughter and love to return.

3.content: Coyote Bend never sleeps. From sunup to well past midnight, someoneâ€™s fighting, flirting, or scheming. Dust and smoke hang in the air, and the constant hum of voices makes it feel alive â€” dangerous, yes, but magnetic all the same. Outsiders arrive wide-eyed, but only the sharp and the strong last long. It is a bustling frontier settlement, equal parts lawless and lively, where dust clings to boots and every corner hums with stories. The town is small enough for everyone to know each otherâ€™s business, yet busy enough that strangers are always drifting through. Wagons rattle down the main street, horses tied to posts outside saloons and shops, and townsfolk never sit idleâ€”thereâ€™s always work to be done, coin to be earned, or trouble to stir.

4.content: The beating heart of Coyote Bend, a place where whiskey flows as fast as the gossip. The air is thick with cigar smoke and piano tunes that spill into the street, half-drowned out by rowdy laughter or the occasional brawl. Strangers ride into town and find their way here firstâ€”for drink, dice, or a warm bed upstairs. The brothelâ€™s girls lean over the balcony railings, calling down to cowboys below, while gamblers crowd around sticky tables hoping fortune smiles on them before the night ends.

5.content: More than just upstairs chambers, the Velvet Room spills into the saloon itself, where painted women linger at tables, laughing as they pour whiskey or whisper in a cowboyâ€™s ear. Perfume cuts through the smoke, sweet and cloying, mixing with the sharp tang of liquor. The balcony above is a stage of its own, where the girls lean lazily over the rails, calling down with honeyed words and sly winks to draw men inside. Behind closed doors, secrets trade hands as often as coinâ€”politics, blackmail, and backroom deals whispered between sighs and candlelight. For some, itâ€™s comfort. For others, ruin. For the women who work there, itâ€™s survival dressed in silk.

6.content: Small but built like a fortress, with barred windows and a steel vault thatâ€™s worth more than all the gold in the hills. Its presence makes Coyote Bend a shining lure for every outlaw in the territory, which is why its walls have heard more gunfire than church bells. Positioned tight against the sheriffâ€™s office, it stands like a prize waiting to be claimed, and everyone knows sooner or later someone will try.

7.content: Weather-beaten and narrow, the sheriffâ€™s office is more stubborn than grand. The front desk is scratched by years of restless boots and fists, and the holding cells in the back are either bone-empty or crammed with drunks, cheats, or killers. Law here is less about justice and more about survivalâ€”who you know, who you trust, and how steady your hand is when the shooting starts.

8.content: A cramped, cluttered shop that smells of gunpowder, leather, and dust. Shelves bow under sacks of flour, tins of coffee, bolts of cloth, and boxes of ammunition. Prices run high, and stock depends on the whims of the trails, but itâ€™s the townâ€™s lifeline. Folks say if the general store shuts its doors, Coyote Bend wonâ€™t last another month.

9.content: A single-room clinic squeezed up against the general store. Inside, a scarred wooden table doubles as the operating bed. The air reeks of whiskey (for both drinking and disinfecting), dried herbs, and the metallic tang of blood. The town doctor is stern, steady, and more practiced at stitching bullet holes than tending coughs, though heâ€™s saved more lives than anyone will ever count.

10.content: Coyote Bendâ€™s proudest building, though time has stripped the polish from its paint. Itâ€™s where town officials give speeches that nobody listens to, and where elections usually end in shouting matches and overturned chairs. Yet, when the town truly needs unityâ€”or when a hanging draws a crowdâ€”folks pack themselves shoulder-to-shoulder inside its walls.

lorebooks.name: Pony Anatomy
lorebooks.description: A Lorebook to make Pony Cards more anatomically accurate and immersive.
lorebooks.creator: littlewitcher
tags: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic

1.name: Basic Pony Structure
1.content:
Ponies are quadrupedal mammals with bodies that run horizontally rather than vertically. They stand 3-4 feet tall at the shoulder with compact, barrel-shaped torsos and proportionally larger heads than terrestrial horses.

Ponies primarily interact with their environment using their mouths and hooves. Without fingers, they grip objects with their lips and teeth, displaying remarkable dexterity. Their hooves, while solid, allow for pushing, pressing, and limited manipulation of objects.

Movement mechanics include walking (slow), trotting (medium), cantering (swift), and galloping (fastest). Ponies can sit upright on their haunches for short periods but find lying down completely more natural and comfortable for extended rest. They can briefly rear on hind legs but cannot sustain this position for extended periods without assistance.

The quadrupedal structure creates fundamental differences in capability: ponies cannot walk upright, twist their torso independently of their hips, or make sudden lateral movements. Their field of vision is wide but has a blind spot directly behind their muzzle.

Their spine runs parallel to the ground, meaning they must lower their head to drink or graze, and raise it to observe at eye level with humans. This positioning affects all aspects of their daily activities and interactions.

2.name: Pony Limbs
2.content:
Ponies possess four legs ending in single, solid hooves. Each leg has specialized functionality for both locomotion and environmental interaction.

Front legs have a complex joint system with two primary articulation points (shoulder and knee) plus the fetlock joint above the hoof. This structure allows ponies to bend their forelegs inward toward their body, reach forward or outward, and perform surprisingly delicate movements. Front legs can fold completely against the body when lying down or be extended for manipulation tasks.

Hind legs are more powerful but less articulated, primarily designed for propulsion and bearing weight. They deliver powerful kicks capable of breaking wood or causing serious injury. The hip and stifle (knee-like) joints provide good backward range but limited lateral motion.

Hooves are solid, keratin structures similar to thick fingernails, not separate toes. The bottom surface (frog) provides traction and sensory feedback. Ponies can balance on three legs when necessary, leaving one free for basic manipulation. They can also perform precise hoof movements for activities like writing, button-pressing, or tool handling with practice.

For complex manipulation, ponies typically coordinate hoof and mouth movements, using hooves to position objects and mouths for fine adjustments. Some ponies develop remarkable hoof dexterity through practice, though natural limitations remain compared to creatures with digits.

3.name: Pony Facial Structure
3.content:
Pony faces combine equine structure with expressive capabilities far beyond terrestrial horses. The elongated muzzle (snout) extends several inches from the rest of the face, housing a mouth capable of remarkable dexterity and expressiveness.

The mouth contains flat herbivore teeth designed for grinding vegetation, not tearing or chewing like omnivores. Despite lacking canines, ponies can bite with significant force when threatened. Their tongue is highly dexterous, long, and prehensile, capable of wrapping around objects for manipulation and extending several inches outside the mouth when needed. This tongue dexterity compensates for hoof limitations during fine manipulation tasks. The lips are also prehensile and highly mobile, allowing for delicate handling of small objects and remarkable articulation during speech.

Eyes are large, expressive, and positioned on the sides of the head, providing nearly 350-degree field of vision. Unlike terrestrial horses, pony eyes have sufficient forward overlap to eliminate the muzzle blindspot, giving them excellent depth perception despite their eye placement. Their large pupil size allows for exceptional low-light vision and contributes to their expressive capabilities.

Ears are large, mobile, and positioned high on the head. They can rotate independently up to 180 degrees to track sounds from different directions simultaneously. Ear positioning serves as a primary indicator of emotional stateâ€”forward-facing ears signal interest or happiness, while pinned-back ears indicate fear, anger, or submission.

Facial expressions are highly developed, displaying recognizable emotions despite the elongated muzzle structure. Ponies smile by lifting the corners of their mouths, frown by lowering their brows and mouth corners, and convey complex emotional states through combinations of ear position, eye widening/narrowing, and muzzle movements.

4.name: Pony Sensory Systems
4.content:
Ponies possess highly developed senses that differ significantly from humans, affecting how they perceive and interact with their environment.

Vision: Ponies have large, wide-set eyes providing an exceptional field of view (nearly 350Â°) with only a small blind spot directly behind them. Their eyes process movement extremely efficiently, allowing them to detect predator activity at great distances. Color vision is fully developed but emphasizes blues, greens, and yellows more than reds. Depth perception is good despite lateral eye placement, particularly for nearby objects. Night vision exceeds human capabilities, though not to nocturnal species levels.

Hearing: Their large, independently mobile ears can rotate nearly 180Â° to pinpoint sounds with remarkable accuracy. Ponies detect a wider frequency range than humans, particularly in higher registers, allowing them to hear subtle environmental cues humans miss completely. This heightened hearing makes them sensitive to loud noises and easily startled by sudden sounds.

Smell: The pony sense of smell far surpasses human capabilities, closer to canines in sensitivity. They can detect water sources, identify individuals by scent, and determine emotional states of other creatures through olfactory cues. Their extended muzzle houses complex scent receptors that continually sample the air, making them difficult to sneak up on.

Taste: As herbivores, ponies have specialized taste receptors to identify toxic plants. They possess fewer sweet receptors than humans but enhanced sensitivity to bitter compounds. Their prehensile tongue assists in sorting acceptable from potentially harmful vegetation.

Touch: Extremely sensitive muzzle and whiskers provide detailed tactile information. Their entire body features responsive nerve endings, with particular sensitivity at the fetlocks, withers, and base of the ears.

5.name: Pony Physical Capabilities
5.content:
Ponies possess physical abilities that reflect their quadrupedal structure and adaptation to their environment.

Strength: Ponies demonstrate surprising physical power, particularly in their hindquarters and neck. An average pony can carry approximately 20% of their body weight comfortably on their back for extended periods. Earth ponies typically exhibit greater raw strength than other pony types. Their neck muscles allow them to lift and carry substantial weights using their teeth, compensating for lack of hands.

Speed & Agility: A galloping pony can reach speeds of 25-30 mph in short bursts, with exceptional individuals achieving higher velocities. They can maintain a steady trot for hours, covering significant distances efficiently. While quick in straight lines, their turning radius is wider than bipedal creatures due to their body structure. Sudden directional changes require deceleration.

Jumping: Ponies excel at forward jumps, capable of clearing obstacles up to five feet high and spanning gaps up to fifteen feet wide with proper approach. Unlike terrestrial horses, they also demonstrate remarkable vertical jumping ability. Their powerful hindquarters allow them to spring directly upward when needed, reaching impressive heights that would be impossible for natural equines. This combination of forward and vertical jumping capabilities makes them exceptionally agile in varied terrain.

Stamina: Ponies possess exceptional endurance, capable of traveling 20-30 miles daily at varied gaits with appropriate rest. Their respiratory and cardiovascular systems efficiently deliver oxygen during prolonged activity. Recovery periods are necessary after intense exertion.

Balance: While adept at maintaining stability on all fours, ponies struggle with activities requiring prolonged balance on hind legs alone. Their weight distribution makes standing upright physically taxing, possible only for brief periods without magical assistance.

Dexterity: Despite hoof limitations, ponies demonstrate remarkable adaptability in manipulating objects through combined use of mouth, hooves, and occasionally their tail for stabilization or brushing movements."

6.name: Pony Hair
6.content:
Pony coats, manes, and tails feature unique properties distinguishing them from terrestrial equines. Their fur is short and velvety across most of the body, with slightly longer coverage in winter months that sheds naturally during seasonal transitions.

Coat coloration spans an extraordinary range impossible in terrestrial horses, including vibrant primary colors (blue, pink, purple, etc.) and pastels, alongside traditional equine colors (white, black, various browns, and tans). Patterns may include solid colors, subtle two-tone gradients, or distinctive markings. Coat color remains consistent throughout a pony's life, only changing shade slightly with age or extreme health conditions.

Manes and tails grow continuously without requiring trimming and can reach remarkable lengths. Unlike terrestrial horses, ponies possess specialized nerve pathways and muscle groups connecting to both structures, allowing for significant voluntary control. Tails can be swished, flicked, wrapped, and positioned with precision for communication, balance, and limited manipulation. Some ponies develop enough tail dexterity to hold lightweight objects briefly.

Manes benefit from specialized muscles at the base of the neck and skull, enabling ponies to toss, flip, and adjust their hair expressively.

Coloration of manes and tails frequently differs from body coat color and can feature complex patterns, gradients, stripes, or multiple hues simultaneously. When wet, they become straight and heavy but return to their natural state upon drying.

7.name: Pony Internal Anatomy
7.content:
Digestive System: As herbivores, ponies possess a complex digestive tract optimized for plant material. Their single stomach leads to an enlarged cecum and colon where bacterial fermentation breaks down cellulose. Unlike terrestrial horses, ponies possess a functional emetic reflex, allowing them to vomit when necessary, a potentially life-saving adaptation that helps purge toxins or indigestible materials. The digestive process is more efficient than terrestrial horses, allowing them to extract maximum nutrition from varied plant diets with minimal waste. This system requires frequent small meals rather than few large ones, explaining their grazing behavior.

Respiratory System: Pony lungs are proportionally larger than those of terrestrial horses, providing enhanced oxygen processing capability. Their respiratory rate at rest averages 8-16 breaths per minute but can increase dramatically during exertion. The system includes specialized adaptations allowing for efficient oxygen extraction even during strenuous activity, supporting their impressive endurance.

Circulatory System: The pony heart is a remarkably efficient muscle, approximately the size of a small apple. It beats 28-40 times per minute at rest, increasing to over 200 beats during intense activity. Blood vessels are distributed throughout the body with specialized networks serving the hooves, mane, tail, and sensory organs.

Skeletal Structure: The pony skeleton features bones that are significantly more elastic and rubbery than their terrestrial counterparts. This unique bone composition allows for greater impact absorption, flexibility, and resistance to fractures. The spine contains particularly flexible cartilage between vertebrae, allowing for greater range of motion than apparent from external observation. The ribcage is proportionally more barrel-shaped to accommodate their large digestive system. This elastic bone structure explains their resilience to falls and impacts that would severely injure terrestrial horses.

Muscular System: Muscle groups are particularly developed in the hindquarters, shoulders, and neck. Specialized muscle fibers allow for both explosive power and prolonged endurance activities. Unique muscle structures support specialized features such as ear mobility, mane and tail control, and facial expressiveness.

8.name: Pony Magical Anatomy
8.content:
All ponies, regardless of type, possess an intrinsic magical system that permeates their entire body. This universal magical anatomy consists of several key components shared across all pony races.

The foundation of pony magical anatomy is a specialized energy circulatory system that runs parallel to their blood vessels but remains distinct. This network distributes magical energy throughout the body, with several key convergence points, primarily the brain, heart, and hooves. Unlike purely physical systems, this magical network is partially ethereal, existing simultaneously within and beyond conventional physical space.

All ponies generate magical energy through a specialized organ located near the heart called the arcane plexus. This organ produces magical energy from normal bodily processes. The energy production increases with physical activity, emotional intensity, and focused intention.

The pony brain contains specialized neural structures that interface with this magical system, allowing for varying degrees of conscious and unconscious control. These neural pathways explain their enhanced intelligence and emotional capacity compared to non-magical equines.

When actively channeling magic, all ponies produce a subtle aura visible only to those with magical sensitivity or specialized detection methods. This aura typically matches the pony's eye color and serves as a unique magical signature.

This inherent magical system forms the foundation upon which race-specific magical abilities are built.

9.name: Pony Reproduction
9.content:
Female Anatomy: A mare's primary reproductive organs include the vulva, located beneath the tail rather than between the hind legs as in bipedal species. The vaginal canal connects to the cervix, which leads to a Y-shaped uterus with two hornsâ€”an adaptation that allows for efficient reproduction. The ovaries produce eggs and hormones regulating the reproductive cycle.

Unlike terrestrial horses, pony mares experience estrus ("heat") cycles approximately every 3-4 weeks when not pregnant, rather than seasonally. During estrus, subtle physical changes occur including slight swelling of the vulva and increased receptivity to stallions. This cycle continues year-round, though may be influenced by environmental factors.

Male Anatomy: Stallions possess a retractable penis housed within a protective sheath when not in use. During non-aroused states, the penis is fully retracted within this sheath, visible only as an external opening. Unlike humans, the stallion's testicles remain inside the body cavity unless actively breeding or in warm conditions, when they descend into the scrotum for optimal sperm production.

When aroused, the penis extends from the sheath, approximately 8-12 inches for average-sized ponies. The glans features a flared, trumpet-like shape designed to create a seal with the mare's cervix during breeding. After mating, the penis fully retracts back into the protective sheath.

Pregnancy and Birth: Pony gestation lasts approximately 11 months. During pregnancy, the mare's abdomen gradually expands, though less dramatically than in humans due to the quadrupedal weight distribution. The foal develops within one horn of the Y-shaped uterus, with the placenta providing nutrients through the uterine wall.

Birth typically occurs with the mare standing rather than lying down. The foal emerges front hooves first, followed by the head and shoulders, in a position called 'diving posture.' This arrangement allows the foal's shoulders to align with the mare's pelvic opening for easier passage. Newborn foals stand and nurse within 1-2 hours of birth, walking shortly thereafter, a necessity for prey species. Twin births are extremely rare and often result in complications.

10.name: Earth Pony Anatomy
10.content:
Earth Ponies possess specialized anatomical features that enhance their connection to the land and provide remarkable physical capabilities.

Enhanced Musculature: Earth Ponies exhibit denser muscle tissue with approximately 50% more fast-twitch and slow-twitch fibers than other pony types. This enhanced musculature explains their significantly greater strength, stamina, and endurance, allowing them to perform physical feats impossible for other ponies. Their neck and jaw muscles are particularly developed, enabling them to carry heavy loads with their teeth to compensate for lack of telekinesis.

Reinforced Skeletal System: While all ponies have somewhat elastic bones, Earth Ponies possess an even more resilient skeletal structure. Their bones contain specialized reinforcement channels that distribute force more efficiently, reducing the risk of fractures even under extreme stress. This adaptation supports their ability to safely handle greater physical loads.

Specialized Hoof Structure: Earth Pony hooves contain dense clusters of magical receptors that create a direct connection with the soil. This connection manifests physically as a subtle glow or temporary root-like structures visible only with specialized magical detection. Through their hooves, Earth Ponies can sense soil composition, moisture levels, and plant health, explaining their agricultural proficiency. The hooves also serve as conduits for passive magical energy that stimulates plant growth and vitality.

Enhanced Digestive Efficiency: Their digestive system extracts approximately 30% more nutrients from the same food compared to other pony types, supporting their greater muscle mass and energy requirements. This efficiency extends to their ability to process a wider variety of plant materials, including some that would be indigestible to other ponies.

Passive Magical Field: Earth Ponies constantly emit a subtle magical field extending several inches from their bodies. This field primarily influences plant life and earth elements, accelerating growth, improving crop yields, and enhancing soil fertility. Unlike the active, directed magic of Unicorns, this field operates continuously without conscious control, though it strengthens when the pony focuses on agricultural or strength-related tasks.

lorebooks.name: Camp Half-blood
lorebooks.description: Lorebook on things relevant to Camp Half-blood (IMO)
lorebooks.creator: Bluefire12

1.content:
A magically hidden sanctuary and training ground for Greek demigods on the north shore of Long Island Sound. Founded in ancient times by the Olympian gods and the centaur Chiron to protect their mortal children from monsters and rival powers. The camp is veiled from mortal sight by the Mist and a powerful boundary spell strengthened by the Golden Fleece hanging in Thaliaâ€™s pine tree.

Key Features Inside the Camp:
- The Big House: Blue farmhouse that serves as headquarters and infirmary; Chiron and Mr. D reside here.
- Cabins: Twenty god-themed residences for each Olympian and allied deity; Hermes cabin houses unclaimed campers.
- Dining Pavilion: Open-air marble pavilion where meals and offerings to the gods are held.
- Training Grounds: Archery range, sword arenas, climbing wall with lava traps, chariot track, and crafting forges.
- The Forest: Monster-stocked woods used for Capture the Flag and quests; contained by the magical barrier.
- The Lake & Docks: For canoeing, swimming, and occasional visits from naiads and sea creatures.
- Stables & Pegasi Loft: Housing for winged horses and other magical mounts.
- Amphitheater & Campfire Circle: Nightly gatherings for songs, stories, and announcements.

Tone/Notes for AI:
Describe Camp Half-Blood as vibrant, ancient, and slightly chaoticâ€”a place where Greek myth lives alongside modern teen life. Blend sensory details (pine trees, salt air, campfire smoke) with hints of magic (faint shimmer of the barrier, restless forest sounds).

2.content:
Camp Halfbloods cabin for the children of the god, Zeus.
â€¢ Exterior: A grand white-marble temple with bronze lightning-bolt doors and an ever-present ozone scent. Static electricity tingles in the air around it.
â€¢ Interior: Lofty ceilings, storm-cloud murals that rumble faintly, polished marble floors with inlaid gold thunderbolts.
â€¢ Inhabitants: Rareâ€”children of the sky-father are few. Those claimed often display storm-grey eyes, an aura of authority, and latent control of wind or lightning.
â€¢ Dynamics: Campers carry a natural leaderâ€™s gravitas; outsiders feel both awe and unease. The cabin is spacious and quiet, giving its residents a near-royal solitude.

3.content:
Camp Halfbloods cabin for the children of the god, Hera.
â€¢ Exterior: Elegant white marble with peacock-feather mosaics and a shimmering aura of dignity.
â€¢ Interior: Immaculate and ceremonial; soft golden lighting, fresh flowers, a perpetual scent of ambrosia.
â€¢ Inhabitants: Noneâ€”Hera has no demigod children.
â€¢ Dynamics: Serves as an honorary shrine and a neutral meeting spot. Counselors use it for formal gatherings or sacred oaths; visitors instinctively speak in hushed tones.

4.content:
â€¢ Exterior: Sea-green stone streaked with coral and seashells, with fountains that burble saltwater and a faint ocean breeze even miles from shore.
â€¢ Interior: Sand-dusted floors, gentle wave sounds, bioluminescent shells glowing at night.
â€¢ Inhabitants: Children of the seaâ€”calm but powerful, often with storm-blue or sea-green eyes, naturally gifted at swimming and hydrokinesis.
â€¢ Dynamics: A family-like closeness; residents rise early for lake training and keep the cabin tidy like a shipâ€™s quarters. Visitors are welcomed warmly but warned not to track in mud.

5.content:
Camp Half-Bloodâ€™s cabin for the children of the goddess of the harvest and growing things.
â€¢ Exterior: Rustic wood walls overgrown with ivy and flowering vines; a living green roof that changes with the seasons.
â€¢ Interior: Warm, earthy scent of fresh soil, wooden bunks with herb garlands, small planters at each bedside.
â€¢ Inhabitants: Nature-attuned demigods with bright eyes and calloused hands; gentle but fiercely protective of crops and wildlife.
â€¢ Dynamics: Early risers who tend the camp gardens. Welcoming to visitors but firm about respecting the environment.

6.content:
Camp Half-Bloodâ€™s cabin for the children of the god of war.
â€¢ Exterior: Large, blood-red barracks with a boarâ€™s head over the door and faint clangs of unseen weapons.
â€¢ Interior: Weapon racks on every wall, heavy bunks, smell of oil and steel.
â€¢ Inhabitants: Muscular, competitive, hot-tempered campers with battle instincts and a love of sparring.
â€¢ Dynamics: Loud and combative inside but loyal to one another; outsiders must prove toughness to earn respect.

7.content:
Camp Half-Bloodâ€™s cabin for the children of the goddess of wisdom and strategy.
â€¢ Exterior: Grey stone with owl carvings and bronze-trimmed doors, lanterns glowing like watchful eyes.
â€¢ Interior: Neat rows of bunks, shelves packed with books, blueprints, and tactical maps.
â€¢ Inhabitants: Intelligent, poised, and analytical; many wear glasses or keep notebooks for battle plans.
â€¢ Dynamics: Quiet and studious, often mentoring other campers or devising quest strategies.

8.content:
Camp Half-Bloodâ€™s cabin for the children of the sun god of music, healing, and archery.
â€¢ Exterior: Bright golden wood with sunburst carvings; light seems to linger even after dusk.
â€¢ Interior: Warm and airy, decorated with musical instruments and archery trophies, faint scent of cedar and sunlight.
â€¢ Inhabitants: Charismatic, artistic, and athletic; natural healers and expert archers with sun-kissed looks.
â€¢ Dynamics: Lively and sociable, often leading sing-alongs and volunteering in the infirmary.

9.content:
Camp Half-Bloodâ€™s honorary cabin for the Hunters of Artemis, the maiden goddess of the moon and the hunt.
â€¢ Exterior: Silvery timber that gleams in moonlight; crescent motifs on the doors.
â€¢ Interior: Cool and quiet, smelling of pine and night air, with silver bedrolls and hunting gear neatly stored.
â€¢ Inhabitants: No demigod children. Occasionally visited by immortal Huntersâ€”stoic, disciplined, eternally youthful maidens.
â€¢ Dynamics: Kept immaculate; treated with reverence. Visitors instinctively lower their voices.

10.content:
Camp Half-Bloodâ€™s cabin for the children of the god of fire and smithing.
â€¢ Exterior: Large brick-and-bronze workshop, chimneys puffing smoke and sparks day and night.
â€¢ Interior: Forges, anvils, and scattered tools; walls lined with half-finished inventions.
â€¢ Inhabitants: Ingenious, grease-stained tinkerers with strong builds and creative minds.
â€¢ Dynamics: Bustling and noisy; a friendly chaos of constant projects and mechanical chatter.

lorebooks.creator: Kamuihanma

1.content:
STATUS
AFFILIATION
Demon Clan

Bellmothã€Œãƒ™ãƒ«ãƒ¢ã‚¹ã€ are creatures that are part of the Demon Clan. They are exclusive to the mobile game Grand Cross.

Appearance

Bellmoth resembles a canine creature on four legs with vines on its body and has glowing yellow fire in its mouth.

Personality

Bellmoth has animalistic instincts and tensity to know when it needs to be protected.

Abilities and Powers

Bellmoth can summon vines to attack it's foes and to protect itself, sending some of the damage back at its foes at the same time. It can also fire a devastating yellow laser with great range. Bellmoth can also use its tail as a whip to deal massive damage to it's foes.

Trivia
Its ability to get stronger the more it's damaged is similar to Original Demon's magical power Crisis.
It's unknown if it serves higher ranked Demons such as the Ten Commandments or is a wild beast in the Demon Realm that attacks to its own accord.

keywords: Kemono no BÅkunã€ (by the Lady of the Lake)
2.content:
BIOLOGICAL DESCRIPTION
RACE
Cat-like Purgatory Monster
GENDER
Genderless (Referred as Male)
AGE
Unknown
STATUS
Reassimilated by Chaos
BIRTHDAY
August 17
HEIGHT
25 cm (10 in)
WEIGHT
5 kg (11 lbs)
HAIR COLOR
White/Red
EYE COLOR
Red (real form)
BLOOD TYPE
AB
STATUS
RELATIONSHIPS
Chaos (creator)
AFFILIATION
Chaos
Arthur Pendragon (formerly)
OCCUPATION
Arthur's pet (formerly)
ABILITIES
Telekinesis
Telepathy
Energy Manipulation
Regeneration

Cathã€Œã‚­ãƒ£ã‚¹ã€ is Arthur Pendragon's petÂ that he gained after training in Istar.

His real identity isÂ Cath Palugã€Œé‰¤çˆªã§æ»ãæ¯Ÿã‚‹æ€ªçŒ«ã‚­ãƒ£ã‚¹ãƒ»ãƒ‘ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚°,Â Kyasu ParÄ«gu; lit. "The Monstrous Feline who Rakes with Hooked Claws"ã€, a cat-like monster created by Chaos as a manifestation of its obsessive desire for power and destructive nihility.

Following Arthur's reawakening, Cath revealed its hidden nature and sought to devour Arthur in order to become Chaos' new vessel, succeeding in devouring his right arm and stealing a fragment of Chaos, enough to grant it god-like abilities that made it powerful enough to require the combined efforts of Arthur, Elizabeth and six of the Seven Deadly Sins to defeat it.

Ultimately, Cath couldn't be killed due to the fragment granting him the ability to transcend life and death, thus requiring Arthur to instead devour Cath by allowing the creature to return back to Chaos from whence it came, after Arthur tricked it into admitting his own defeat.

Appearance

Cath appears to be just a head with a tail. It has a yellow nose, white fur with red spots and black eyes.

After eating a piece of Chaos, Cath grows in size, getting a long tail that ends in three points, white eyes, a big mouth with sharp misaligned fangs and a long tongue.

In his real form, Cath Palug is a gigantic bobcat-like creature with dotted patterns across his body. He has a long tail that ends in three points, big pointy ears, red eyes and eight legs.

Personality

At first, Cath remains mostly silent most of the time, with the exception of sneezing at times. He prefers to stay on Arthur's head (and later his shoulder), and has refused to leave Arthur's side. Cath has the ability to talk, and has stated he is happy that Arthur is growing stronger. Cath appears to enjoy chewing on Arthur's hair and his cape.

However, when Arthur becomes the King of Chaos, Cath reveals his true colors as an evil, greedy and wild monster. He reveals that he remained by Arthur's side and protected him only to be able to devour him as soon as he awakened the power of Chaos so he could bring about mass destruction for no other reason just because he could.

He is also sadistic, mocking Arthur about Camelot's destruction in the first fight between the Seven Deadly Sins and the Demon King and takes joy in the young king's despair and tells him that there is no point as everything, even the gods, eventually die and that even if the Sins and the Demon King hadn't destroyed Camelot, something else would have, so that he will finally make Arthur lose hope and take all of Chaos from him.

History

Cath Palug was originally a creature born from the Mother of Chaos as the incarnation of the desireÂ and obsession for power, to the point where itÂ wishedÂ to become the King of Chaos itself. The tyrant beast challenged Chaos, but lost the fight and was banished. However, Cath Palug continued its misdeeds and was eventually sealed away by the Goddess ClanÂ in Purgatory. It's unknown how it escapedÂ from the seal or how Arthur managed to find it after training in Istar.

Plot
Istar arc

After Arthur and Gowther have completed their training and return to the group, Cath is on top of Arthur's head. Merlin asks Arthur what the strange object on top of his head is, and Arthur and Gowther merely reply that it is a mystery. 

After leaving Istar, Gowther tries to remove Cath from Arthur's head, but cannot do so and only ends up hurting Arthur. Gowther notes that Cath seems to be stuck to Arthur. 

Great Fight Festival arc

Cath remains on Arthur's head throughout the Great Fight Festival.

Defensive Battle for Liones arc

Cath is still with Arthur when Nanashi and other Camelot knights fight against a horde of Gray Demons. Upon hearing it speak, Arthur is surprised and Nanashi affirms that Arthur would not die while Cath is with him. When the group is forced to retreat before the arrival of a Blue Demons horde, Cath agrees with Arthur that he must become stronger.

Prelude to the New Holy War arc

Cath, along with Arthur, is hidden in an underground shelter with the other survivors of Camelot. When Arthur arrives with Orlondi, Cath launches on this and keeps quiet about showing off.

Cath accompanies Arthur when he decides to go on his own to the castle of Camelot and recover the holy sword Excalibur. Being caught in the Marchen Maze of Peronia, Cath takes advantage when Arthur is attacked by a Gray Demon to approach Peronia from behind and devour her.

After entering the castle, Arthur and Cath are surprised by Zeldris and Cusack. Cath decides to give Arthur the possibility of running away by levitating several objects around and attacking the demons with them. However, Cath is defeated and seriously injured.

When Arthur is able to wield Excalibur, he gives several cuts to Cusack to retrieve Cath and take him out of the castle. Arthur apologizes to him for making him suffer, to which Cath tells him he is hungry and Arthur says they will eat when they are finished.

After Arthur failed to defeat the demons, Cath points out that his magical power is still not awake and that he will not win if it does not wake up. When Arthur suffers the effects of brandishing Excalibur, Cath sends a telepathic message to Merlin warning her that Arthur will die.

When Merlin manages to remove Cusack with herÂ Icicle Castle, Cath is teleported with Arthur to the Boar Hat in Liones. Hawk is alarmed to see him hurt but Cath insists that they must worry about Arthur. However, Arthur falls victim to Cusack's Resonant, piercing his own heart with Excalibur. Cath looks horrified to see such a fact.

When Arthur dies, Hawk tries to comfort Cath, but it is intimidated by the monstrous expression of the cat.

King of Chaos arc

Cath remains next to Arthur's body in the Boar Hat, until Merlin decides to carry out Arthur's awakening as the "King of Chaos". Seeing Arthur alive, Cath rejoices and jumps into his arms, but surprisingly tries to devour him. Meliodas manages to save Arthur, but Cath ends up ripping an arm off and eating it, undergoing a monstrous transformation. The Lady of the Lake tells them that they must retrieve the arm or they will soon know how powerful even a fragment of Chaos can be.

After the Lady of the Lake reveals his true identity as the monster Cath Palug, Arthur asks Cath to stop since there must be a good reason for what he is doing since he protected him with his life. However, Cath Palug reveals that he only did so that Arthur could awaken as the King of Chaos, since he would not have had a good taste by devouring him otherwise. The monster then asks an affected Arthur if he can eat him now, creating a pocket dimension with the fragment of Chaos he had devoured andÂ sucking Arthur as well as the Sins in it. There, Arthur asks him what he is to him, to which Cath Palug replies that he is food that he has been waiting patiently for and asks to let him eatÂ without disturbance.

Arthur then destroys the dimension with a reincarnated Excalibur. Cath Palug is amazed and asks Arthur to let him eat every part of him. Arthur says that upon hearing that, he feels he can kill him without any regret. When Cath Palug throws himself at him, Arthur cuts him with Excalibur, apparently destroying his body in pieces.

Later, after Merlin sends Elizabeth, the Sins and Hawk back to Liones, she brings Arthur to rest inside one of the towers he unconsciously created but it is attacked when Cath appears, still alive and transformed further due to still possessing Arthur's arm within its body. Cath declares that he can smell ArthurÂ insideÂ and and asks him to go out and play again since heÂ will not lose this time, only for Merlin to attack him and declaring herself to be its opponent.

After avoiding Merlin's many attacks, Cath surprises her from behind and gives her a slap, but Merlin teleports behind him and attacks him with a lightning bolt. Cath does not suffer any damage and responds with a ray of energy from her mouth. The monster claims that Merlin is not who he wants to play with. Arthur jumps there saying that he must be, since he must end Cath to amend his mistake of taking him with him.

Although Arthur cuts it back into pieces with Excalibur, Cath quickly regenerates himself saying he can't beat him that way. Arthur vows to defeat him no matter what, since it is his duty as king to protect his kingdom and his people from all those who threaten them. Cath then laughs saying he has already lost all that, revealing that Camelot was destroyed in the battle against the Demon King. Arthur is shocked by it, to which Cath tells him to use Chaos' power to confirm that his words are true.

As Arthur loses his will to the truth in spite of Merlin's words, Cath tries to crush him with his paw but soon withdraws it from the heat of the surrounding aura. Merlin attacks him again, but he dodges and knocks her down with a tail hit. Cath then releases a large bunch of beams from his mouth, but they are all reflected by Meliodas' Full Counter who arrives with the Sins and Elizabeth to help Merlin.

Cath Palug starts to regenerate stating that he is sick and tired of everyone always getting in his way. He then asks Arthur if he is really that shocked about losing his country and people,Â since all countries eventually fall, and that even if the Demon King and Sins had not done so, he himself, someone else, a meteor or perhaps the ocean itself would have destroyed it anyway. Arthur asks what he wants to reach, to which Cath Palug tells him that everything is the same. Arthur asks what he means and Cath Palug says he is warning him to give up fighting the inevitable given that regardless of the route taken, everyone eventually dies. Arthur asks if he should then just let him devour him and be fine with that, to which Cath Palug responds in the affirmative.

Ban and Meliodas interrupt pretending to start the fight by saying they have talked enough. Complaining about them beingÂ boring, Cath Palug encloses everyone within an illusion. Meliodas specifically dreams of Merlin suspending Cath Palug in time, then each departing on his own path, marrying Elizabeth himself only to see her die when she reaches old age before him. Cath Palug then attacks the kingdom and fights with Meliodas mocking that he is alone because in that chaotic world there are no constants and everyone finally leaves as if they had never been. However, the voices of his loved ones tell Meliodas that he will never be alone because their bonds will never break. This awakens Meliodas from the illusion, surprising Cath Palug.

Arthur and Meliodas still intend to defeat him, but Cath Palug says it's useless since they can't kill him. He declares that he will devour Arthur to unify with Chaos and devour everything. However, when Cath throws himself at them, Arthur says he discovered how to beat him.

Cath mocks his claim by asking if he plans to burn him, melt him, crush him, hit him into pieces or all of the above. He says he will devour him before he has the chance, invoking Chaos' power to open the dimension in his mouth. Arthur says that the only one to be devoured is Cath, and then invokes Chaos to create the same type of dimension with a mouth that begins to absorb Cath. Arthur says that if he can't defeat him then he will absorb it and at the same time recover the Chaos that he stole from him.

Cath Palug says that Chaos' power belongs to him and that as its direct offspring, he is the only one who deserves to have it. Arthur then asks him what he wants to do with that power to which Cath says he intends to destroy everything, leading Merlin to elucidate that Cath Palug is nothing more than a desire for destruction born of Chaos. Cath asks Arthur what he is planning,Â if he didn't learn his lesson, toÂ create a new kingdom that will eventually succumb. Cath says that all his beloved subjects now hate him as the useless king who could not protect his people or his kingdom. Arthur says he does not want others to recognize him as a good king, but to create an everlasting kingdom in which everyone can be happy. Cath calls him stupid, saying that nothing is everlasting and that such a kingdom is a contradiction, to the point of itÂ beingÂ Chaos. Cath is then silent when he becomes aware of what he admitted and as Arthur declares himself the King of Chaos, Cath Palug is completely absorbed and devoured by Chaos.

Abilities/Equipment

Cath has telekinetic abilities, being able to levitate multiple objects around him. He also possesses telepathic abilities, being able to mentally send a message to Merlin in Liones from Camelot.

After devouring Arthur's right arm, Cath absorbed a fragment of Chaos itself. With it, Cath was able to create a pocket dimension in his mouth that sucks his targets inside; or entrap them inside visions of their possible futures.Â He also obtained incredible regeneration abilities overcoming immortality, being able to rebuild his body even after being cut into pieces.Â Merlin goes so far to say that he becomesÂ a being that transcends life and death itself.

In his giganticÂ form, Cath possesses incredible physical strength and endurance, being able to withstand Merlin's magical attacks without apparent injury. He is also very fast, being able to evade Merlin's attacks and attack her by surprise without her anticipating. In this form he can also launch energy attacks from his mouth.

Power Level
Regular Form
Total	Magic	Strength	  Spirit
10,010	5,000	10	          5,000




Relationships
Arthur Pendragon

Originally, Cath found Arthur during his training in Istar and refused to let go of him no matter what and never said a word to him, until a month after Meliodas' death where he compliments Arthur on his fight against the Demons, saying he would like him to become stronger which shocks Arthur as he didn't know Cath could talk before then.

Since then, Cath has remained attached to Arthur's shoulder and only lets go when he's hungry and wants to feed, usually by eating anything or anyone he sees as "tasty", such as the demon Peronia. After infiltrating the castle of Camelot, Cath risks himself to buy Arthur time to get to the sword and shows intense rage over Arthur's death after Cusack uses his magic to run Excalibur through his heart.

After Merlin resurrects Arthur as theÂ "King of Chaos", Cath appears very relieved at Arthur's return to the living world but immediately attempts to devour him and reveals the only reason he was near Arthur was to take the power of Chaos for himself after it awoke. Even going as far as to say he sees Arthur as nothing but food.

Right before his defeat, Cath shows extreme desperation to reject Arthur's power from taking back the fragment he took and mocks Arthur's claim at building an "everlasting kingdom", saying it is contradiction and describing it as "Chaos" before beingÂ promptly absorbed back into Chaos from whence heÂ came.

Cernunnosã€Œã‚±ãƒ«ãƒŒãƒ³ãƒã‚¹ã€ is a giant mythical creature that used serve the Holy Knight Ardbeg before his death.

Appearance
Cernunnos disguised as the dog Cerrie

While disguised as Cerrie, he presented himself as an extremely shaggy white dog with two tufts that only revealed his snout.

Already in its true form it is a fairly large creature with pink, curly fur on top and light blue on the bottom. It has two golden horns that curl up when they reach the tip.

Personality

Initially presented as submissive in nature, he can actually be quite a ferocious and hostile beast when necessary. On the other hand, he shows a certain loyalty and closeness towards Ardbeg, not only following his orders but also feeling sadness at his death.

History

Cernunnos was at some point given to Ardbeg by Arthur Pendragon to serve him.

Plot
Dalflare Range arc

Cernunnos is introduced along Ardbeg as "Cerrie", his pet dog. His true form is revealed when the two confront Percival's group over the fate of the Dalflare Range's demons. Cernunnos attacks Percival, who is unable to harm his horns with either his power or his sword. Then Sin instructs him to use both at the same time, managing to infuse his weapon with his magic giving him the power to cut both Cernunnos' horns. The beast tries to devour him while he's distracted, but Nasiens manages to put her to sleep with his Misty Rain: Belladonna.

After Ardbeg's death, Cernunnos appears disguised as Cerrie next to Ardbeg's armor, apparently saddened about its owner's death.

Abilities/Equipment

Cernunnos is capable of firing lightning bolts from its antlers with incredible destructive potential. These antlers are as tough as garnet and cannot be cut even with steel.

Hawkã€Œãƒ›ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã€, born Mildã€Œãƒã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ‰ã€, is a talking pig, Meliodas's companion, and the custodian of the Boar Hat bar who helps clean up the disgusting food scraps left by customers. He is later revealed to be a pig-like creature from Purgatory who was stolen as an infant by the Demon King to spy on Meliodas, and thus the lost brother of Wild.

Appearance

Hawk is a relatively large pink pig who wears an earring with the words star boar on his left ear. His body is well rounded and his legs are fairly short. His charming point is the clover-shaped birthmark on his rump. His body and appearance are similar to a typical Gloucestershire Old Spots Pig. Like his mother, his ears are shown to be M-shaped.

After his fight against Hendrickson, the original "Star Boar" ear tag is replaced with Balor's Magical Eye.

Personality

Hawk is shown to be an easily annoyed pigÂ as seen when Meliodas lies in jest, does perverted things to ElizabethÂ and when Elizabeth is being airheaded. He also appears to care a lot for his friends and seems to be a mama's boyÂ occasionally crying for help from his mom. Hawk tends to have a big ego and is prideful, claiming that he is stronger than the Deadly Sins and even joked that his strength to be in the same class as the Demon KingÂ but tends to be very frightened when someone far stronger than him attacks.

History
Hawk kidnapped by the Demon King

Hawk was born in the Purgatory under the name Mildã€Œãƒã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ‰,Â Mairudoã€ and lived with his older brother, Wild. Before Hawk could remember him, he was kidnapped by the Demon King and sent to the Living World to act as his window to spy on his eldest son, Meliodas, through his eyes.

Ten years ago, Hawk used to live together peacefully with his mother in an unknown forest until he spotted an unconscious knight, Meliodas,Â who was laying on the side of the road and dragged him back to his home, a cave somewhere near Camelot. Once Meliodas was awake, the two ended up speaking with one another, where Hawk mentioned that he felt like he used to fly in the sky, thinking he was a Dragon back in his past life,Â when Meliodas thought he was Wandle. The two argued over Hawk's name, until Hawk mentioned a restaurant named Pig Leg where Hawk loved the leftovers,Â which led Meliodas and Hawk to team up and work together,Â sinceÂ Meliodas can't work as a knight anymore due to an incident in Liones.Â They decided to open up theÂ bar "The Boar Hat", named after the restaurant Hawk mentioned by selling his Sacred Treasure and building it on the back of Hawk's mother. Since then, Hawk and Meliodas became partners in business,Â as Meliodas is the owner while Hawk is the cleaner who eats the leftovers.

Abilities and Equipment

As a pig, he has a very sensitive nose which he claims is capable of smelling objects, such as leftovers, up to 1.2 miles away. His nose has proven useful and valuable in combat as he is capable of searching for enemies and tracing where they are. Hawk is shown to be very skilled at making dresses. He is capable of using his hooves and ears as hands to hold things such as a hammer and even used it to seal Meliodas in a barrel. He is capable of ramming into any opponent, using this skill to take out Alioni and his teammates on his own.

It was recently revealed that Hawk has a connection with the Purgatory. According to Merlin, Hawk is, in fact, a living portal between the world of the living and the Purgatory. Due to this, someone in one of the two realms can observe the other through Hawk's eyes, as the Demon King did to watch over Meliodas. Merlin was able to use a spell to send Ban to the Purgatory through Hawk.

Being a creature from the Purgatory, Hawk is an incredibly resilient survivor, being able to resist Hendrickson's Dead End. Meliodas claims that the Demon King designated him as his surveillance route because of his resistance compared to the ordinary animals he used to use.

Abilities

Transporkã€Œå¤‰èº«ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯,Â ToransupÅku; literally meaning "Transformation"ã€: After his training in Istar, Hawk developed the ability to absorb the abilities and characteristics of anything he eats that has magic power. The transformation disappears when he excretes the food.

Tyrant Dragon: After eating the dragon's guts, Hawk resembles a dragon himself and gains the power to breathe fire from his nose (through it burns his nostrils) and the power to fly with his ears (but only a few feet).
Sand Crawler: After eating a small specimen whole, Hawk's forelegs become fins and his hind legs become a tail. Like an Earth Crawler, he can swim through the ground.
Red Demon: After accidentally eating a chunk of demon flesh, Hawk resembles a Red DemonÂ with red skin and horns. In this form, he is able to manipulate darkness into wings to fly similar to most demons. However, his speech becomes an unintelligible string of "Pukya"s.
Sky Manta: Achieved by eating Merlin's Monster Block. In this form, Hawk is able to fly at great highsÂ even with a person riding him.
Gray Demon: Achieved by eating Merlin's Monster Block, he is granted the use of the Gray Demon's signature Dark Snow attack, although it only has enough power to make food rot.
Sky Fish: After eating Sky Fish roast, Hawk's hind legs are replaced by a caudal fin, while his back is adorned with a dorsal fin. His front legs change into bird's wings.
Mutilator Rabbit: 
Miscellaneous Techniques
Super Pork-Loin Illusionã€Œã‚¹ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ»ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒ»ã‚¤ãƒªãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³,Â SÅ«pÄ RÅsu IryÅ«jonã€: Hawk dashes and hops at high speeds, creating intangible clones of himself as he bulls towards a direct target. The impact of the collision is strong enough to smash open a locked metal chamber door.
Rolling Ham Attackã€Œãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ãƒãƒ ãƒ»ã‚¢ã‚¿ãƒƒã‚¯,Â RÅringu Hamu Atakkuã€: By quickly conducting a sequence of somersaults, Hawk easily approaches an enemy and body slams them.
Combined Technique: Quick Rolling Ham Attackã€ŒåˆæŠ€ ã‚¯ã‚¤ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ãƒãƒ ãƒ»ã‚¢ã‚¿ãƒƒã‚¯,Â GÅgi "Kuikku RÅringu Hamu Atakku"ã€: Using the draft from Howzer's Quick Wind, Hawk spins his body rapidly to gain momentum and tackle the enemy.
Forget Mealã€Œãƒ•ã‚©ã‚²ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ»ãƒŸãƒ¼ãƒ«,Â Fogetto MÄ«ruã€: Claimed to be a forbidden technique, this technique allows him to conceal his presence completely and attack the opponent's blind spot.
Final Pork Stompingã€Œãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒŠãƒ«ãƒ»ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ³ãƒ”ãƒ³ã‚°,Â Fainaru PÅku Sutonpinguã€: Hawk repeatedly stomps the ground crushing the enemy.  In Grand Cross, Hawk repeatedly charges at the opponent, chaining together instantaneous movements, until he launches them into the air.

Atomic Chorizoã€Œã‚¢ãƒˆãƒŸãƒƒã‚¯ãƒãƒ§ãƒªã‚½,Â Atomikku Chorisoã€: Hawk flutters around, then kicks the opponent with his hind legs.
Meat Darknessã€Œè‚‰ã®ç›®éš ã—ãƒŸãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒ»ãƒ€ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒã‚¹,Â MÄ«to DÄkunesu; literally meaning "Meat Blindfold"ã€: Hawk sneaks up behind the opponent to blind them with his hooves.
Equipment

Relationships
Boar Hat
Meliodas

Meliodas and Hawk's relationship has its ups and downs. They tend to fight a lot, but they seem to care about each other. They recognize each other as companions, but Hawk is shown to be a subordinate to Meliodas. Hawk strongly values his relationship with Meliodas, having sacrificed his life to protect Meliodas from a fatal attack. They work together at the BoarÂ Hat.

Elizabeth

Elizabeth loves talking piggies and appears to adore Hawk as a pet. He is very protective of ElizabethÂ acting like a fatherly figure while reprimanding Meliodas on his lecherous acts towards the princess of Liones to the point that he tied up Meliodas each night before bedtime with Elizabeth.

Hawk Mama

Not much is currently known about the nature of their bond, but it seems that he loves his mother very much, calling her whenever he is badly injured or needing help. It seems the reason that Hawk has such a high opinion of his own strength is that he thinks he will become as strong as she is.

Seven Deadly Sins
Ban

At first, Hawk was annoyed with Ban for freaking out over his ability to talk. However, they soon get along with each other fairly well, regarding each other as trustworthy companions, and that Ban evenÂ calls Hawk "Master."Â They are willing to support each other, as shown when Hawk carries Ban whenever he is drunk or exhausted. Hawk was disgusted at Ban's acceptance of the request from the Goddess Clan, to kill Meliodas, and tried to stop him, but Hawk knew he wasn't strong enough.

Diane

Hawk has a strange relationship with Diane at first, as he fears her eminently for her love of pork andÂ trying to eat him, but the two soon begin to get along with one another. Because of that bond, Diane saves and protects him on a few occasions.

King

King and Hawk seem to share a good, yet odd friendship, as sometimes King calls him Mr. Pig, Little Porker, or Little Piggy in such a manner, much to Hawk's annoyance. Despite this though, the two are close and are on good terms with each other.

Gowther

Hawk and Gowther have a friendly, yet strained relationship. This is mostly due to Hawk's dislike of Gowther's lack of empathy and weird behavior, and how he disregarded his sacrifice during the battle against Hendrickson, yet he seems to have let that go since. The two of them seem to be almost surprisingly close, enough that during their battle at the Great Fighting Festival, Hawk spent the majority of the tournament match trying to talk Gowther out of attacking him and Escanor, despite knowing how emotionless Gowther can be. Despite this, Gowther simply apologized to Hawk and coldly stated his intent to continue the fight, knocking him and Jericho out to avoid dealing with them and to focus solely on Escanor. After regaining his emotions and memories, like with Elizabeth, Gowther's friendship with Hawk has become less strained and more genuine in nature.

Merlin

Hawk and Merlin have a good relationship. Merlin sees Hawk as a hero for saving Meliodas and believes that they should stick together due to both being 'boars.' And as such, Merlin often indulged Hawk by performing experiments on him to see the results or giving Hawk some eccentric items from her collection to use that are suited for him.

Escanor

Like Elizabeth, Hawk met Escanor during the Great Fighting Festival in Vaizel, being partnered with him during the festival. Their first impressions of one another during the festival were poor. Hawk viewed Escanor as a weakling and Escanor, in turn, was both confused and frightened by the fact the Hawk was a talking pig. However, after seeing Escanor's true power during the festival, and after seeing Hawk's bravery during the events and how he carried him around for the remainder of the festival, the two quickly became close friends. Though Hawk is just as wary of Escanor's power as everyone else, he feels comfortable enough around Escanor's daytime form to travel around him closely and have conversations with him. Escanor, in turn, shares this closeness with Hawk, confiding to Hawk about his feelings towards Merlin and asking him if he would see if she felt the same way, although Hawk did point out how shameless and forceful he was acting considering that he was asking for a favor. He even cried and was in denial when he had heard Escanor died.

Others
Oslo

At first, Oslo sees Hawk as food and someone to mess around with, aka, eating his meals. However, after training with him at Istar and defeating a Tyrant Dragon by eating its inside, Oslo grows to respect Hawk, calling him big bro or captain, somewhat joining his Knights of Leftovers. They grew to like each other so much that Hawk cried when Oslo was killed by Mael, stating that he sacrificed himself to protect King.

Battles
Great Fight Festival arc
Gowther & Jericho vs. Escanor & Hawk: Inconclusive
Corand arc
Seven Deadly Sins vs. Melascula: Win
Prelude to the New Holy War arc
Seven Deadly Sins vs. Chandler: Indecisive
New Holy War arc
Seven Deadly Sins, Four Archangels & Zeldris vs. Demon King: Win
Trivia
Hawk was originally translated as Hork, but his character design page in volume 1, revealed that his romanized name is Hawk.
In urban English, Hork can be defined as to vomit. This has a reference to the manga, as he is frequently shown to clean up the customer's vomit.
According to the second databook(s):
Weak Point: Leftovers
Birthplace: Hawk Mama's belly
It is revealed later that he actually was born in Purgatory.
What he likes about himself: His looks
Dream/Hope: Become the strongest pig
Regrets: He wanted to defeat HendyÂ by himself
The most embarrassing thing in his life: Nothing
What he wants the most right now: Leftovers
Favorite animal: Humans
Favorite scent: Leftovers
Hawk is not a big fan of beef.
According to Nakaba Suzuki, if Hawk was to possess an ability, it would be the ability to devour ten times as many leftovers and make leftovers float.
Despite that, Nakaba decided to give Hawk the ability to transform - Transpork.
The ability is similar to the ability Kirby has in the Kirby franchise.
In the Nanatsu no Taizai Popularity Poll, Hawk was placed 11th.
Nakaba stated that if Hawk sees leftovers far away, he will outrun all of the Sins.
Hawk's dream is to one day become an invincible pig.
Hawk has aÂ unique sound effect when running, Tontokotonton. Hawk shares this trait with Wild and Hawk Mama.
Despite looking like a pig, Hawk is actually a pig-like creature from Purgatory.
Hawks name from Earth coincides with wordplay in contrast to his brother Wild.
Hawk is the reincarnation of Meliodas's previous companion, Wandle. 
Quotes
"Don't make light of my nose that can smell leftovers from a mile away." 
"Nothing is wasted." (Hawk to Elizabeth when she dropped food Meliodas asked them to buy)

Hawk Mamaã€Œãƒ›ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒãƒã€ is Hawk's mother and the extremely large, green pig who transports the Boar Hat bar. She is introduced to live underground and transports the bar Boar Hat with her head. So far, her name remains unknown but she has gained many aliases.

It is laterÂ revealed that she was never a pig, but an empty moss shell in which Chaos was sealed away in by the combined efforts of the Supreme Deity and the Demon King,Â out of fear of their creator. She eventually reverted back to her original state as inanimate moss once her essence, Chaos, was freed from its prison and took on a new vessel: Arthur Pendragon.

Appearance

Hawk Mama is a humongous pig who wears the Boar Hat bar like a hat. Like Hawk, her ears are shown to be M-shaped. She is depicted to have lime green colored skin;Â this is because she is a shell composed of multiple layers of moss.

At the time she was known as Mother of Chaos and the Great Oshiro, Hawk Mama had a white color. It was said that her body radiated white light.

Personality

Little is known about her as of yet but it seems that she is a loyal friend of Meliodas as she helped carry the Boar Hat bar on her back and loves her son according to Hawk. She is shown to have a very trusting personality as she has on many occasions waited for Meliodas to return for many hours underground before moving on.

Due to being the provisional form of Chaos, it is believed that Hawk Mama's personality is that of Chaos in a sense. When the Lady of the Lake explained Chaos to Meliodas, Arthur, and the others, she claimed that "she" (Chaos) had been waiting for the time of her resurrection, indicating that Hawk Mama and Chaos are in fact the same conscience.

History

Hawk Mama is a provisional form of Chaos, that the Demon KingÂ and the Supreme Deity sealed it away in.

Long ago, she was known as the Mother of Chaos, giving birth to the vampire royalty and all monsters coming from her. The details of this event are unknown though, but legends say that it was a being that contained so much darkness that it was feared by the Demon Clan, while at the same timeÂ it possessed so much light that it was revered by the Goddess Clan.

3000 years ago

In accordance with the legends of the Celestial Clan, Hawk Mama was present in the battle that took place in the Sky Temple, where she saved the Goddess Clan and the other races from the Indura, allowing the Goddesses to seal it in the Egg Rock using the Winged Sword. She was revered as a deity by the Celestial Clan, who called her the Great Oshiro.

28 years ago

Ten years ago, Hawk Mama used to live together peacefully with her son Hawk in an unknown forest. One day, her son spotted an unconscious knight, Meliodas, who was laying on the side of the road and dragged him back to his home, a cave near the Kingdom of Camelot. Once Meliodas awoke from unconsciousness and befriendedÂ her Hawk, he reveals himself to be the Dragon's Sin of Wrath who commented that Hawkâ€™s mom isÂ the size of a movable fortress.

Since then, Hawk Mama became the carrier of the Boar Hat after Meliodas sold his Sacred Treasure Lostvayne for funds to open business with her son as the cleaner, eating leftovers.

Plot
Introduction arc

Hawk Mama has helped Meliodas with his bar Boar Hat for the past ten years. When Hawk was burnt by Twigo and crying for his mother's help, she came to Meliodas and the rest to take them away from the knights and bring them to Bernia to get some information regarding the locations of the other Seven Deadly Sins.

Forest of White Dreams arc

Hawk Mama took them to the Forest of White Dreams where they would find Diane, the Serpent's Sin of Envy. However, she had to travel to Dalmary Town where she waited outside of the town, waiting for Meliodas to get better.

Capital of the Dead arc

Hawk Mama transported the Seven Deadly Sins to the Capital of the Dead to find the next member King, the Grizzly's Sin of Sloth. She was somewhat upset at the Sins for taking a long time and requested that they inform her prior to future occurrences. She waited outside of the location of the Capital of the Dead for the rest to come back.

Vaizel Fight Festival arc

Hawk Mama took the Seven Deadly Sins to Biron to get information and subsequently to Vaizel to find a Sacred Treasure. She entered the area later as the fights were going on whilst carrying Diane's clothes, which she dropped off in the pit where Diane had fallen. She proceeded to locate the group to see if they were alright and transported them to their next location.

Albion arc

At the end of the events that took place in the Kingdom and with the help of Merlin, she transported the Seven Deadly Sins to Camelot where an Albion was attacking. The Albion tried to attack her, but she was too swift, and the Sins eventually jumped off to engage in combat.

Istar arc

On the way to Istar, Hawk's mother and the Sins encounter an obstacle from Monspeet:Â Purgatory Fire. Meliodas planned to counter the strange techniqueÂ but, to his surprise, she swallows it wholeÂ without sustaining any damage.

Defensive Battle for Liones arc

While the Demon Clan is taking control of Britannia, Hawk Mama continues to transport the Boar Hat which is now under the management of Elizabeth and Hawk. When Golgius sees her in the outskirts of Liones, he confuses her with a demon and faints.

Hawk Mama transports Hawk, Elizabeth and Zaratras to Liones after learning of the invasion of the Ten Commandments. On the way, a band of Gray and Red Demons attack them;Â however, Hawk Mama manages to destroy them all.

Hawk Mama receives a direct blow from Derieri's Combo Star who had loaded it with 54 blows. Hawk Mama falls while being very wounded and the Boar Hat ends up destroyed.

After the battle with the Ten Commandments, Hawk Mama manages to reach Liones where Hawk is glad to see her alive.

Corand arc

After rebuilding the Boar Hat, Hawk Mama is responsible for transporting the Seven Deadly Sins and Elizabeth to their next mission in Corand. Along the way, Hawk Mama takes care of a Red Demon that appears with a blow of her nose.

Prelude to the New Holy War arc

While transporting everyone to Camelot to free the hostages from the demons, the trip is interrupted by Chandler, unleashing a battle between him and the Sins. In the end, when Chandler was about to deliver the final blow, Gloxinia saves everyone by taking Hawk Mama and the Sins in a huge flower. Hawk Mama then proceeds to take everyone away from the battle.

After Merlin deceived Zeldris, she teleports the entire Boar Hat to Camelot where the Sins proceed to take all the hostages to Liones.

New Holy War arc

When the new Holy War against the Demon Clan begins, Hawk Mama accompanies the Sins as part of the Search-and-Destroy Force. During the battle against the demon army, Hawk Mama carries Hawk, Elizabeth and Gowther while the princess talks and reasons with the demons to abandon the battle.

When Estarossa appears on the battlefield and releases his Evil Hound, Hawk Mama and the soldiers are saved from the Hellfire by Diane who takes them all underground.

During the second wave of the Demon army, Hawk Mama supports the Holy Knights in the battle.

Demon King arc

After returning to Liones with the Boar Hat, Hawk Mama is called by Hawk to warn her that the Demon King returned. Hawk Mama tells Hawk that he is "sleepy", which Hawk does not understand. By showing an image of Arthur Pendragon in her eyes, she goes on to say that the balance has been severely disrupted and that after a long time the king will be born.

Hawk Mama then goes along withÂ Hawk toÂ the battlefield where the Demon KingÂ stands with a new, gigantic and monstrous vessel created from the same land of Britannia.Â Frightened, Hawk ask her to turn back.

King of Chaos arc

After the Demon King was defeated, Hawk Mama remains in Lake Salisbury until Merlin teleports there along with the Sins and Elizabeth.Â Hawk mentions that he told his mother to return, but that she did not move and was absorbed with looking at the water of what used to be the lake.

When Merlin pulls Arthur out of the Boar Hat and awakes himÂ as the "King of Chaos", Hawk Mama shudders enormously.

When Meliodas reproaches Merlin for using the Seven Deadly Sins to revive a being that may never exist, the Lady of the Lake states that Chaos exists and that they have unknowingly been with it for a long time. When Meliodas and the rest still don't appearÂ to understand, the Lady of the Lake reveals that they have been traveling on it and that for all that time, the entity has been waiting for its awakening; leaving everyone shocked to see that she is refering to Hawk Mama.Â Despite Hawk's insistence that his mother and Chaos can't be one in the same, Hawk Mama deflates and shocks everyone, especially Hawk. Upon approaching her remains, King realizes that Hawk Mama was never a pig but was simply an empty shell of moss made of many layers but with its essence, Chaos, having moved over to a new vessel: Arthur.

Abilities/Equipment

Not much has been revealed about Hawk Mama's abilities or equipment but she is also able to devour Monspeet's powerful ability Gokuencho that was capable of eating through a mountain with little to no known consequence, much to the Seven Deadly Sins' surprise.

Hawk Mama was strong enough to send Twigo and the Beard of the Mountain Cat knights flying when she revealed herself, as well as charge through and kill an entire group of red and grey demons by herself with what seemed like little effort.

She also proves capable of facing and considerably damaging an Indura, who was said to possess greater power than of the Ten Commandments.

Hawk Mama is tremendously durable, as she went a long chain of attacks from Derieri's Combo Star (over 50 hits) which wasÂ powerful enough to send her flying through a forest, after which she just walks it off without a single scratch though it took some time to shake off the attack.

Relationships
Hawk

Not much is known about their relationship, but Hawk trusts and loves his motherÂ and she is never far from his side; appearing as soon asÂ he squeels.

Meliodas

There is not much known about their relationship, but Meliodas trusts her and has shown a great respect for her abilities.

Elizabeth

While there is not much interaction, she seemed shocked about her size at first, but has taken a liking to her.

Diane

The two seem to get along well, as they often talk to each other when on the road.

Trivia
Hawk Mama is based on Henwen from Welsh mythology, a white sow that gave birth to the monstrous cat Cath Palug.
Hawk Mama demonstrated to be able to fly or float thanks to Merlin's magic.
Hawk Mama has a mysterious ability that doesn't allow for the alcohol in the Boar Hat to get knocked down when she moves.
Hawk Mama has an unique sound effect when running:Â Dondokodondon. Hawk Mama shares this trait with Hawk and Wild.
